SNV.desc: SNVs are single nucleotide positions in genomic DNA at which different sequence alternatives exist.

substitution.desc: A sequence alteration where the length of the change in the variant is the same as that of the reference.

Alu_deletion.desc: A deletion of an Alu mobile element with respect to a reference.

Alu_insertion.desc: An insertion of sequence from the Alu family of mobile elements.

HERV_deletion.desc: A deletion of the HERV mobile element with respect to a reference.

HERV_insertion.desc: An insertion of sequence from the HERV family of mobile elements with respect to a reference.

LINE1_deletion.desc: A deletion of a LINE1 mobile element with respect to a reference.

LINE1_insertion.desc: An insertion from the Line1 family of mobile elements.

SVA_deletion.desc: A deletion of an SVA mobile element.

SVA_insertion.desc: An insertion of sequence from the SVA family of mobile elements.

complex_chromosomal_rearrangement.desc: A contiguous cluster of translocations, usually the result of a single catastrophic event such as chromothripsis or chromoanasynthesis.

complex_structural_alteration.desc: A structural sequence alteration or rearrangement encompassing one or more genome fragments, with 4 or more breakpoints.

complex_substitution.desc: When no simple or well defined DNA mutation event describes the observed DNA change, the keyword 'complex' should be used. Usually there are multiple equally plausible explanations for the change.

copy_number_gain.desc: A sequence alteration whereby the copy number of a given regions is greater than the reference sequence.

copy_number_loss.desc: A sequence alteration whereby the copy number of a given region is less than the reference sequence.

copy_number_variation.desc: A variation that increases or decreases the copy number of a given region.

duplication.desc: An insertion which derives from, or is identical in sequence to, nucleotides present at a known location in the genome.

interchromosomal_breakpoint.desc: A rearrangement breakpoint between two different chromosomes.

interchromosomal_translocation.desc: A translocation where the regions involved are from different chromosomes.

intrachromosomal_breakpoint.desc: A rearrangement breakpoint within the same chromosome.

intrachromosomal_translocation.desc: A translocation where the regions involved are from the same chromosome.

inversion.desc: A continuous nucleotide sequence is inverted in the same position.

loss_of_heterozygosity.desc: A functional variant whereby the sequence alteration causes a loss of function of one allele of a gene.

mobile_element_deletion.desc: A deletion of a mobile element when comparing a reference sequence (has mobile element) to a individual sequence (does not have mobile element).

mobile_element_insertion.desc: A kind of insertion where the inserted sequence is a mobile element.

novel_sequence_insertion.desc: An insertion the sequence of which cannot be mapped to the reference genome.

short_tandem_repeat_variation.desc: A variation that expands or contracts a tandem repeat with regard to a reference.

tandem_duplication.desc: A duplication consisting of 2 identical adjacent regions.

translocation.desc: A region of nucleotide sequence that has translocated to a new position. The observed adjacency of two previously separated regions.

deletion.desc: The point at which one or more contiguous nucleotides were excised.

indel.desc: A sequence alteration which included an insertion and a deletion, affecting 2 or more bases.

insertion.desc: The sequence of one or more nucleotides added between two adjacent nucleotides in the sequence.

sequence_alteration.desc: A sequence_alteration is a sequence_feature whose extent is the deviation from another sequence.

probe.desc: A DNA sequence used experimentally to detect the presence or absence of a complementary nucleic acid.

transcript_ablation.desc: A feature ablation whereby the deleted region includes a transcript feature

splice_acceptor_variant.desc: A splice variant that changes the 2 base region at the 3' end of an intron

splice_donor_variant.desc: A splice variant that changes the 2 base region at the 5' end of an intron

stop_gained.desc: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon is changed, resulting in a premature stop codon, leading to a shortened transcript

frameshift_variant.desc: A sequence variant which causes a disruption of the translational reading frame, because the number of nucleotides inserted or deleted is not a multiple of three

stop_lost.desc: A sequence variant where at least one base of the terminator codon (stop) is changed, resulting in an elongated transcript

start_lost.desc: A codon variant that changes at least one base of the canonical start codon

transcript_amplification.desc: A feature amplification of a region containing a transcript

feature_elongation.desc: A sequence variant that causes the extension of a genomic feature, with regard to the reference sequence

feature_truncation.desc: A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a genomic feature, with regard to the reference sequence

inframe_insertion.desc: An inframe non synonymous variant that inserts bases into in the coding sequence

inframe_deletion.desc: An inframe non synonymous variant that deletes bases from the coding sequence

missense_variant.desc: A sequence variant, that changes one or more bases, resulting in a different amino acid sequence but where the length is preserved

protein_altering_variant.desc: A sequence_variant which is predicted to change the protein encoded in the coding sequence

splice_donor_5th_base_variant.desc: A sequence variant that causes a change at the 5th base pair after the start of the intron in the orientation of the transcript

splice_region_variant.desc: A sequence variant in which a change has occurred within the region of the splice site, either within 1-3 bases of the exon or 3-8 bases of the intron

splice_donor_region_variant.desc: A sequence variant that falls in the region between the 3rd and 6th base after splice junction (5' end of intron)

splice_polypyrimidine_tract_variant.desc: A sequence variant that falls in the polypyrimidine tract at 3' end of intron between 17 and 3 bases from the end (acceptor -3 to acceptor -17)

incomplete_terminal_codon_variant.desc: A sequence variant where at least one base of the final codon of an incompletely annotated transcript is changed

start_retained_variant.desc: A sequence variant where at least one base in the start codon is changed, but the start remains

stop_retained_variant.desc: A sequence variant where at least one base in the terminator codon is changed, but the terminator remains

synonymous_variant.desc: A sequence variant where there is no resulting change to the encoded amino acid

coding_sequence_variant.desc: A sequence variant that changes the coding sequence

mature_miRNA_variant.desc: A transcript variant located with the sequence of the mature miRNA

5_prime_UTR_variant.desc: A UTR variant of the 5' UTR

3_prime_UTR_variant.desc: A UTR variant of the 3' UTR

non_coding_transcript_exon_variant.desc: A sequence variant that changes non-coding exon sequence in a non-coding transcript

intron_variant.desc: A transcript variant occurring within an intron

NMD_transcript_variant.desc: A variant in a transcript that is the target of NMD

non_coding_transcript_variant.desc: A transcript variant of a non coding RNA gene

coding_transcript_variant.desc: A transcript variant of a protein coding gene

upstream_gene_variant.desc: A sequence variant located 5' of a gene

downstream_gene_variant.desc: A sequence variant located 3' of a gene

TFBS_ablation.desc: A feature ablation whereby the deleted region includes a transcription factor binding site

TFBS_amplification.desc: A feature amplification of a region containing a transcription factor binding site

TF_binding_site_variant.desc: A sequence variant located within a transcription factor binding site

regulatory_region_ablation.desc: A feature ablation whereby the deleted region includes a regulatory region

regulatory_region_amplification.desc: A feature amplification of a region containing a regulatory region

regulatory_region_variant.desc: A sequence variant located within a regulatory region

intergenic_variant.desc: A sequence variant located in the intergenic region, between genes

sequence_variant.desc: A sequence_variant is a non exact copy of a sequence_feature or genome exhibiting one or more sequence_alteration
